metadata.title: KOLAR FULURI | কলার ফুলুরি | Bengali Recipe
metadata.description:
Kolar Fuluri by Gita Shil I রুরাল রেসিপির দ্বাদশ তম পর্ব । পূর্ব বর্ধমানের বননবগ্রামের বাসিন্দা শ্রীমতি গীতা শীল এর হাতের রান্না :  কলার ফুলুরি ।

In bygone eras, kitchens served as experimental laboratories where new culinary creations were born regularly. With purchasing food not a common practice, homemade sweets were the norm.  Kolar phuluri, reminiscent of banana fritters shaped like flowers, epitomizes this tradition.  Crafted from bananas, coconut, wheat flour, suji (granulated wheat), and sugar, phuluri offers a delightful treat suitable for any time of the day.

Rural local recipes are integral part of Intangible Cultural Heritage and needs to be preserved and promoted. We at banglanatak dot com have been working for the past 22+ years to safeguard and promote local cultural heritages in rural spaces across India.  We are now launching a new initiative of documenting rural recipes and bringing them closer to the food lovers of the world.  We request all to subscribe to our new channel Rural Recipes and stay tuned there to know, learn and try out local delicacies.

Presenter: Debalina Bhowmick
